member.summary: Resolve a RepRapFirmware/FatFs-style file path to an actual UNIX file path. The first drive (0:/) is reserved for usage with the base directory as specified in the settings.

member.summary: Connection with wrappers to ensure basic operation and convenience wrappers for JSON-style requests

member.summary: Base constructor for connection interpreters. Invoke this from any derived class

member.name: M:DuetControlServer.IPC.Processors.Base.Process
member.summary: Worker method for a given connection. No is passed here, use instead. Once this task exits the connection is terminated.
member.returns: Task that represents the worker lifecycle
member.exception: Thrown if this method is not overridden

member.name: T:DuetControlServer.IPC.Processors.Command

member.summary: List of supported commands in this mode

member.summary: Constructor of the command interpreter

member.summary: Reads incoming command requests and processes them. See namespace for a list of supported commands. The actual implementations can be found in .

member.name: T:DuetControlServer.IPC.Processors.Interception
member.summary: Interception processor that notifies clients about G/M/T-codes being processed

member.name: F:DuetControlServer.IPC.Processors.Interception.SupportedCommands
member.summary: List of supported commands in this mode

member.name: M:DuetControlServer.IPC.Processors.Interception.#ctor(DuetControlServer.IPC.Connection,DuetAPI.Connection.ClientInitMessage)
member.summary: Constructor of the interception processor

member.name: M:DuetControlServer.IPC.Processors.Interception.Process
member.summary: Waits for commands to be received and enqueues them in a concurrent queue so that a can decide when to resume/resolve the execution.
member.returns: Task that represents the lifecycle of the connection

member.name: M:DuetControlServer.IPC.Processors.Interception.EnqueueCommand(DuetAPI.Commands.BaseCommand)
member.summary: Checks if the command request is allowed and enqueues it internally if that is the case. If it is illegal, an exception is thrown that can be sent back to the client.
member.exception: Thrown if the command type is illegal

member.name: M:DuetControlServer.IPC.Processors.Interception.Intercept(DuetAPI.Commands.Code)
member.summary: Called by the implementation to check if the client wants to intercept a G/M/T-code
member.returns: null if not intercepted or a instance if resolved

member.name: M:DuetControlServer.IPC.Processors.Interception.Intercept(DuetAPI.Commands.Code,DuetAPI.Connection.InterceptionMode)
member.summary: Called by the class to intercept a code. This method goes through each connected interception channel and notifies the clients.
member.returns: null if not intercepted and a CodeResult otherwise

member.name: T:DuetControlServer.IPC.Processors.Subscription
member.summary: Subscription processor that notifies clients about object model changes. There is no point in deserializing the object model here so only the JSON representation is kept here.

member.summary: List of supported commands in this mode

member.summary: Constructor of the subscription processor

member.name: M:DuetControlServer.IPC.Processors.Subscription.Process
member.summary: Task that keeps pushing model updates to the client
member.returns: Task that represents the lifecycle of a connection

member.summary: Called to notify the subscribers about a model update

member.summary: Path to the UNIX socket for IPC

member.summary: Maximum number of pending IPC connection

member.summary: Virtual SD card directory. Paths starting with 0:/ are mapped to this directory

member.summary: Bus ID of the SPI device that is connected to RepRapFirmware (on Linux the format is /dev/spidev{bus}.{csline})

member.summary: Chip select line of the SPI device that is connected to RepRapFirmware (on Linux the format is /dev/spidev{bus}.{csline})

member.summary: Number of the GPIO pin that is used by RepRapFirmware to flag its ready state

member.summary: How many bytes to parse max at the beginning and end of a file to retrieve G-code file information

member.name: P:DuetControlServer.Settings.MaxLayerHeight
member.summary: Maximum allowed layer height. Used by the file info parser

member.summary: Regular expressions for finding the layer height (case insensitive)

member.summary: Regular expressions for finding the filament consumption (case insensitive, single line)

member.name: T:DuetControlServer.SPI.Serialization.Reader
member.summary: Static class for reading data from SPI transmissions. It is expected that each data block occupies entire 4-byte blocks. Make sure to keep the data returned by these functions only as long as the underlying buffer is actually valid!
member.remarks: Once C# 3.0 is out, the performance of this can be further improved (without relying on unsafe code) by using Span.AsRef()

member.name: T:DuetControlServer.SPI.Serialization.Writer
member.summary: Static class for writing data for SPI transmissions. This class makes sure each data block is on a 4-byte boundary to guarantee efficient DMA transfers on the remote side.
